extras: 2001,  Carmen Silva-Corvalán,  Sociolingüística y pragmática del español [Spanish sociolinguistics and pragmatics], →ISBN, page 188:Se esperaría mayor porcentaje de dequeísmo cuando el sujeto de la oración principal es impersonal, que cuando es tercera o segunda persona, y que cuando es primera persona (en este orden), dados los diferentes grados de participación en (o distanciamiento de) la aserción codificada en la oración principal asociados con los posibles sujetos de tal aserción.A greater percentage of dequeísmo would be expected when the subject of the main sentence is impersonal than when it's third or second person and than when it's first person (in that order), given the different degrees of participation in (or distancing from) the codified assertion in the main sentence associated with the possible subjects of said assertion.

defs._def: (transitive) to wear (short for the more formal llevar puesto)

defs._def: (transitive) to have, include (have as a component, part, accessory or ingredient)
extras: Si es quesadilla lleva queso, si no lleva queso, no es quesadilla.If it is a quesadilla, it has cheese; if it does not have cheese it is not a quesadilla.(phrase used in the Mexican provinces to debate the usage of the word quesadilla in Mexico City)
Esta palabra no lleva acento.This word does not have an accent mark.
